str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Weeping, lamentation, crying. From klaio; lamentation.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To fall upon, press upon, light upon, come over. From epi and pipto; to embrace or seize.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To kiss affectionately. From kata and phileo; to kiss earnestly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
